summary: Team reviewed Q1 API architecture strategy, focusing on microservices communication patterns
Decided to adopt GraphQL Federation approach over traditional REST APIs for better flexibility
Identified confusion around service boundaries that was resolved through detailed diagram walkthrough
Assigned 3 action items with clear owners and deadlines for next sprint

actionItems.text: Create RFC document for GraphQL schema design patterns and federation strategy
Update testing strategy documentation to include GraphQL query testing approach
Research and propose caching strategy for GraphQL Federation gateway

keyMoments.title: Active Discussion: GraphQL vs REST
keyMoments.description: Team shows high engagement discussing technical trade-offs between GraphQL and REST approaches. Multiple participants leaning forward, taking notes.

keyMoments.title: Decision: GraphQL Federation Proposed
keyMoments.description: Marcus proposes GraphQL Federation as the solution, addressing concerns from both frontend and infrastructure teams.

keyMoments.title: Architecture Diagram Shared
keyMoments.description: Marcus shares comprehensive architecture diagram showing service boundaries and federation strategy.

keyMoments.title: Confusion Detected: Service Boundaries
keyMoments.description: Multiple team members showing confused body language. Elena asks clarifying question about service boundary definitions. Engagement drops to 38%.
keyMoments.resolution: Marcus provided detailed explanation, engagement recovered to 74%

keyMoments.title: Action Item: RFC Creation
keyMoments.description: Sarah commits to creating RFC for GraphQL schema design by next week.

keyMoments.title: Final Decision: GraphQL Federation Approved
keyMoments.description: Team reaches consensus on GraphQL Federation as the architecture choice. Visible agreement signals from all participants.

sentimentAnalysis.notes: Meeting started neutral, built positive momentum during discussion, brief dip during confusion phase, ended strongly positive after decision

participationBalance.recommendation: Consider checking in with quieter team members in 1-on-1s to ensure their perspectives are heard
